snippet: A Newtown, Conn., Starbucks closed early, disappointing some gun owners who had planned to show up wearing holstered pistols to make a statement in favor of gun rights.
abstract: Starbucks in Newtown, Conn, closes early on Aug 9, disappointing some gun owners who planned to show up wearing holstered pistols to make statement in favor of gun rights; plan infuriates some residents still reeling from murder of 26 children at Sandy Hook Elementary School; Starbucks has drawn praise from gun owners for its policy allowing people to openly carry guns in their stores, in states where it is allowed.

byline.original: By PETER APPLEBOME and ELIZABETH MAKER
byline.contributor: Elizabeth Maker contributed reporting from Newtown.

lead_paragraph: A Newtown, Conn., Starbucks closed early, disappointing some gun owners who had planned to show up wearing holstered pistols to make a statement in favor of gun rights.

headline.main: At Newtown Starbucks, a Gun Event Is Shut Out
headline.print_headline: At Newtown Starbucks, A Gun Event Is Shut Out
